thread.title: Santana tribute act to play Hampshire gig
thread.title_full: Santana tribute act to play Hampshire gig

title: Santana tribute act to play Hampshire gig
text:
0 comments 
TOP Latin rock tribute Oye Santana make their first appearance at Basingstoke's Central Studio Theatre on Saturday October 31. Universally acclaimed as the world's best Santana tribute, the band perform all the crowd-pleasers, from early hits such as Jin-Go-Lo-Ba, Samba Pa Ti and Soul Sacrifice to Carlos Santana's modern repertoire, including Smooth, Corazón Espinado and Maria Maria. 
They promise a fiesta-tinged show that will have feet tapping from the first chink of a tambourine to the get-up-and-boogie finale. 
The band is led by Milan 'Carlos' Webb, a virtuoso guitarist with a technique and tone to match Santana himself, who not only sounds the part, but looks the part too. But it's not just about guitar. Hector Gomez (yes, he's Spanish) and Auriol Kobani ensure the vocals (and the stage act) are up to the mark, while Paul 'Murph' Murphy is a powerhouse behind the percussion rig. Share article 
"We concentrate on the hits, played the way people know them from the records," says Milan. "We're not into long self-indulgent solos, and we don't think our audiences are either. At the Central Studio Theatre, just as everywhere we play, our focus will be on entertaining – we like to see people get up and dance." 
Based in the Thames Valley, the band is making waves across the UK, and is touring extensively to promote its new CD. To find our more about the band and to watch their showreel, go to www.oyesantana.com. Tickets for the Basingstoke show [8.00pm] are available on: 01256418318 or visit:https://live.advancedticketing.co.uk/k?v=CentralStudio&item_type=103&general_event_event=OS Promoted Stories Santana tribute act to play Hampshire gig Sorry, an error occurred.
